properties.name: DOTENV_PATH
properties.description: Path to the .env configuration file

properties.name: DOMAIN_OR_PUBLIC_IP
properties.description: Public domain or ip where OpenVidu Server will be accessible

properties.name: HTTPS_PORT
properties.description: Secure port where OpenVidu Server will listen

properties.name: KMS_URIS
properties.description: KMS URL's to which OpenVidu Server will try to connect. They are tested in order until a valid one is found

properties.name: OPENVIDU_SECRET
properties.description: Secret used to connect to OpenVidu Server. This value is required when using the REST API or any server client, as well as when connecting to openvidu-server dashboard

properties.name: OPENVIDU_CDR
properties.description: Whether to enable Call Detail Record or not

properties.name: OPENVIDU_CDR_PATH
properties.description: Where to store CDR files

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING
properties.description: Whether to start OpenVidu Server with recording module service available or not (a Docker image will be downloaded during the first execution). Apart from setting this param to true, it is also necessary to explicitly configure sessions to be recorded

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_DEBUG
properties.description: If true, start recording service in debug mode

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_PATH
properties.description: Where to store the recorded video files

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_PUBLIC_ACCESS
properties.description: 'true' to allow public access to the video files specified in 'openviu.recording.path'. 'false' to only allow access to authenticated users

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_NOTIFICATION
properties.description: Which users will receive a notfication (client events 'recordingStarted' and 'recordingStopped') when recording starts and stops: 'none', 'publisher_moderator', 'all'

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_CUSTOM_LAYOUT
properties.description: Where should OpenVidu Server look for custom recording layouts

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_VERSION
properties.description: Tag for openvidu/openvidu-recording Docker image

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_AUTOSTOP_TIMEOUT
properties.description: Timeout in seconds for automatically stopping the recording of a session when last user disconnects or when it starts and no user is publishing (only if RecordingMode.MANUAL)

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_COMPOSED_URL
properties.description: URL the composed-video recording dockerized Chrome will use to connect to the recording layouts inside OpenVidu Server host. This will affect all video recording layouts (default one BEST_FIT, all CUSTOM layouts). This allows changing the default URL, which is the public URL 'https://DOMAIN_OR_PUBLIC_IP:HTTPS_PORT/', for those cases where OpenVidu Server host does not allow back and forth connections using the public url from inside the host

properties.name: OPENVIDU_RECORDING_COMPOSED_BASICAUTH
properties.description: 'true' to automatically add Basic Auth credentials to the URL passed to the recording container, false otherwise

properties.name: OPENVIDU_WEBHOOK
properties.description: 'true' to enable OpenVidu Webhook service. 'false' otherwise

properties.name: OPENVIDU_WEBHOOK_ENDPOINT
properties.description: HTTP endpoint where OpenVidu Server will send Webhook HTTP POST messages

properties.name: OPENVIDU_WEBHOOK_HEADERS
properties.description: List of headers that OpenVidu Webhook service will attach to HTTP POST messages

properties.name: OPENVIDU_WEBHOOK_EVENTS
properties.description: List of events that will be sent by OpenVidu Webhook service

properties.name: OPENVIDU_STREAMS_VIDEO_MAX_RECV_BANDWIDTH
properties.description: Maximum video bandwidth sent from clients to OpenVidu Server, in kbps. 0 means unconstrained

properties.name: OPENVIDU_STREAMS_VIDEO_MIN_RECV_BANDWIDTH
properties.description: Minimum video bandwidth sent from clients to OpenVidu Server, in kbps. 0 means unconstrained

properties.name: OPENVIDU_STREAMS_VIDEO_MAX_SEND_BANDWIDTH
properties.description: Maximum video bandwidth sent from OpenVidu Server to clients, in kbps. 0 means unconstrained

properties.name: OPENVIDU_STREAMS_VIDEO_MIN_SEND_BANDWIDTH
properties.description: Minimum video bandwidth sent from OpenVidu Server to clients, in kbps. 0 means unconstrained

properties.name: OPENVIDU_STREAMS_FORCED_VIDEO_CODEC
properties.description: Defines which video codec is being forced to be used in the browser/client

properties.name: OPENVIDU_STREAMS_ALLOW_TRANSCODING
properties.description: Defines if transcoding is allowed or not when OPENVIDU_STREAMS_FORCED_VIDEO_CODEC is not a compatible codec with the browser/client.

properties.name: OPENVIDU_WEBRTC_SIMULCAST
properties.description: Use Simulcast video on WebRTC Publishers.

properties.name: OPENVIDU_SESSIONS_GARBAGE_INTERVAL
properties.description: How often the garbage collector of non active sessions runs. This helps cleaning up sessions that have been initialized through REST API (and maybe tokens have been created for them) but have had no users connected. Default to 900s (15 mins). 0 to disable non active sessions garbage collector

properties.name: OPENVIDU_SESSIONS_GARBAGE_THRESHOLD
properties.description: Minimum time in seconds that a non active session must have been in existence for the garbage collector of non active sessions to remove it. Default to 3600s (1 hour). If non active sessions garbage collector is disabled (property 'OPENVIDU_SESSIONS_GARBAGE_INTERVAL' to 0) this property is ignored

properties.name: COTURN_IP
properties.description: Coturn IP of a deployed coturn server

properties.name: CERTIFICATE_TYPE
properties.description: Which kind of certificate shall be used by OpenVidu in production mode [selfsigned,letsencrypt,owncert]

properties.name: MEDIA_NODES_PUBLIC_IPS
properties.description: Additional IP to be returned for each media node in ICE candidates. The format consists on a list of pairs with private ips and public ips [<private-ip>:<public_ip>:...]

properties.name: COTURN_INTERNAL_RELAY
properties.description: If true, coturn is returning the private IP on relayed candidates. This can be useful to know which candidates must be sent when MEDIA_NODES_PUBLIC_IPS is defined

properties.name: COTURN_SHARED_SECRET_KEY
properties.description: If defined, COTURN_SHARED_SECRET_KEY will be used to generate TURN valid users. The same secret should be configured at 'static-auth-secret' to be valid. If empty, OpenVidu Secret is used. (For security, in official deployments for CE/PRO/ENTERPRISE a random string is generated)

properties.name: jsonRpcClientWebSocket.reconnectionDelay
properties.description: Reconnection delay when Kurento Media Server connection is lost (ms)

properties.name: jsonRpcClientWebSocket.timeout
properties.description: Timeout for RPC operations sent to KMS through websocket (ms)

properties.name: jsonRpcClientWebSocket.packetSize
properties.description: Maximum size of packets sent through websocket

properties.name: jsonRpcClientWebSocket.connectionTimeout
properties.description: Timeout for openvidu-server to connect through websocket to KMS (ms)

properties.name: kurento.client.keepAliveTime
properties.description: Heartbeat frecuency between openvidu-server and KMS (ms)

properties.name: ws.sessionReconnectionTime
properties.description: Reconnection timeout between clients and openvidu-server (seconds)

properties.name: ws.maxSessions
properties.description: Maximum number of websocket sessions that openvidu-server will be able to hold
